data_formats: Widely used file formats (Spreadsheet, JSON, GeoJSON, SHP, GPX, KML, XML, TIFF, MP3, MP4, etc.)
name: UK Silvoarable Network data
description: Silvoarable agroforestry (the intercropping of trees and arable crops) can diversify farm incomes, increasing tree planting and improve farm biodiversity. In the UK, in 1992 a silvoarable experiment, comprising three replicate blocks of four poplar (Populus spp.) hybrids (at a spacing of 10 m x 6.4 m) and three arable treatments, was established by Cranfield University in Bedfordshire, Leeds University in West Yorkshire, and the Royal Agricultural University in Gloucestershire.  This web-page provides the data for crop yields (1992-2002) and tree heights and diameters (1992-2001) for the three sites.
keywords: Silvoarable arable crop yields poplar tree heights diameters experiment results
data_project_name: The Impact of Silvoarable Agroforestry with Poplar on Farm Profitability and Biological Diversity
access_barrier: No, direct download/access through a web link

digitaf_data_used: These data have been used to calibrate the Yield-SAFE model
feedback_data_info: Annual tree and crop data from a silvoarable systems is presented for three experimental sites across England in the UK.
